page.title: 15INTERVIEW OF A POSTMAN,GRAYS
page.content: A Grays postman sits in Grays Park eating his sandwiches;it is his lunch break. On questioning him he tells us that he gets up at 5am. every workday. He sets off for the main sorting office in Grays, sorts his rounds letters into bundles and sets off on his bicycle to make his first of two deliveries. He finds the bicycle very useful because of his heavy, awkward bag. His main complaints about being a postman are the rain, unfriendly dogs, and small,awkward letter boxes. Asked if postal deliveries to the home would some day be phased out he tells us that he thinks that home deliveries will continue for some years although modern technology in computers,and greater usage of the telephone is bound to affect the number of postmen required.
